edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.filter
Class Filter

java.lang.Object
  edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.filter.Filter
Direct Known Subclasses:
AntiseedFilter, BackgroundEstimationFilter, BandpassFilter, ConvexHullByLabelFilter, ConvolutionFilter, DilationFilter, FillFilter, GaussianFilter, GaussianFitFilter, GradientFilter, GradientHistogramThresholdingFilter, GraphJoiningFilter, InversionFilter, KernelFilterND, Label3DFilter, LabelBySeedFilter, LabelFilter, LaplacianFilter, LaplacianFilterND, LocalBackgroundEstimationFilter, LocalMaximumSeparabilityThresholdingFilter, MaskFilter, MaximumSeparabilityThresholdingFilter, MergeFilter, OneToOneLabelBySeedFilter, PlaneNormalizationFilter, RecursiveMaximumSeparability3DFilter, RecursiveMaximumSeparabilityFilter, RegionMaximumSeparabilityThresholdingFilter, RegionThresholdingFilter, RelabelFilter, Renormalization3DFilter, RenormalizationFilter, ScalespaceFilter, SeedFilter, SimpleThresholdingFilter, SizeAbsoluteFilter, SizeFilter, TimeAveragingFilter, UnionFilter, VariableSizeMeanFilter, WatershedFilter, ZeroPointFilter
public abstract class Filter
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents an Image operation.

Classes that extend filter implement the apply method, which takes an Image and modifies it in place according to the operation that that particular filter represents. Filters may also use a second Image, called the reference image, for additional information during the processing, but should not modify the reference image. For instance, a filter might take a mask for the Image parameter to the apply function, and operate on this mask, but use the intensity information in a reference image to guide the operation on the mask.

In general, classes that extend filter should document exactly what they expect for the reference image and the Image parameter to the apply function.

Author:
Colin J. Fuller
